title: 90/135/EEC: Commission Decision of 7 March 1990 relating to the plans of certain third countries concerning examination of residues of fresh meat for substances other than those having a hormonal action
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 7 March 1990
relating to the plans of certain third countries concerning examination of residues of fresh meat for substances other than those having a hormonal action
(90/135/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: In view of the plans submitted by the third countries listed in the Annex to this Decision, in respect of examination of residues for the substances set out in Group A III and Group B of the Annex I to Directive 86/469/EEC, the Member States shall continue to authorize imports of fresh meat from those countries, if necessary under the conditions laid down in the Annex to this Decision.
Article 1 of Commission Decision 89/15/EEC is hereby repealed.
This Decision shall be reviewed and any necessary amendents made before 31 May 1990.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 7 March 1990.
For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
